newsitem.title: GERMANY: Tietmeyer - M3 goal based on inflation at 1.5-2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer - M3 goal based on inflation at 1.5-2 pct.

text.p: Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer on Thursday said the Bundesbank's M3 goal assumed unavoidable inflation of 1.5 to 2.0 percent and an increase in the production potential of two percent for 1997 and 1998.
Tietmeyer said the target was based on an expected slowdown in the velocity of money of one percent.
He also said that there may be a money supply overhang at the start of 1997 but that this would not be inflationary.
He said M3 growth could slow in 1997 without foreseeable interest rate increases.
Tietmeyer said that the lower target growth corridor for 1997 of 3.5 to 6.5 percent for 1997 from four-to-seven percent in 1996 made clear that the Bundesbank expected M3 growth to slow gradually.
